Please see attached soliciation and it's Documents **SITE VISIT** The site visit will take place on 5 April 2022 from 10:00 AM ? 12:00 PM.? If you will be attending the site visit, you must notify Sheridan Robison at sheridan.robison@us.af.mil by 30 March 2022 at 10:00 AM.? The email must contain who will be attending and phone numbers for each individual.? YOU MUST RSVP TO THE EMAIL BY THE STATED TIME AND DATE TO BE ALLOWED ON THE SITE VISIT.? You will need to bring a driver?s license to be allowed on the installation. Interested persons may identify their interest and capability to respond to the requirement by submitting a proposal.? Electronic procedures will be used for this solicitation through FedBizOps at https://www.fbo.gov/.? No telephone requests. See Note 22.? Authority is 10 USC 2304 (c) (1).? For further information contact:? Sheridan Robison, Contracting Officer sheridan.robison@us.af.mil

category_id: Equipment: Air Circulation, Boilers, Furnace, Refrigeration Bids
title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): 2750 Compliant Plating Oven
description: This combined synopsis/solicitation is being issued as a request for quotation (RFQ) IAW FAR Part 13. The Air Force Sustainment Center (AFSC/PZIMC) at Tinker Air Force Base Oklahoma, intends to award one firm fixed price contract for the acquisition of a 2750 Compliant Plating Oven.? Class 2 oven compliant with AMS 2750F with the following requirements: Physical Requirements: ? Minimum Internal furnace size: 84? wide, 40? deep, 72? high ? Maximum External footprint: ~100? wide, 72? deep, and 96? high ? Rack layout: 3 removable racks, the lowest one elevated 6? from the bottom, preferably comprised of rollers rated to hold 100 lbs minimum, a middle one sitting at least 24? above that (30? total), and the top rack sitting at least 30? above that (60? total) ? Rack weight rating: bottom rack rated for at least 1000 lb gross load, middle and top rack rated for at least 20 lbs per square foot ? Loading doors: 2 doors, bi-parting that open independently of one another, any mullion present must be removable ? Control cabinet must be accessible within allotted space for furnace, with at least 30? clearance for any electrical door to open Temperature requirements: ? Temperature Range: 250-500F ? AMS 2750F Class 2 (temperature uniformity +/- 10F, maximum SAT difference +/- 3F) Heating: ? Zero-Fired SCR power control ? Heat Input Capacity enough to heat a 1,000 lb steel load from 70? F to 475? F in 1 hour when loaded in to a preheated oven ? Direct drive blowers for recirculation Controls: ? Electrical: 480/3/60 power supply ? Low voltage calibration connections to controller, over temp, and chart recorder ? Low voltage calibration connections shall be located on the exterior of the control panel to allow calibration technicians to perform calibration without needing to access high voltage panels. Instrumentation: ? AMS 2750F compliant type D instrumentation including chart recorder, temperature controller, and over-temperature controller/protection Thermocouples: ? All thermocouples, thermocouple extension wire, and connectors shall meet all technical requirements as detailed by AMS 2750F section 3.1. ? Any and all connectors shall be of standard 2 pin connector type. ? Control thermocouple: Any base metal type excluding type N; preference towards type K, J ? 1 control thermocouple required per oven control zone ? 1 resident SAT thermocouple required per control zone, permanently installed to comply with AMS 2750F, type N SAT probe required. Resident SAT thermocouple shall connect to jack panel connector on furnace control cabinet. ? Nine temperature uniformity survey (TUS) ports shall be installed on the oven. The ports shall be positioned to allow TUS thermocouples to be placed in accordance with AMS 2750F Figure 1. Testing: ? Manufacturer shall perform System Accuracy Test (SAT) before shipment. SAT procedure and results shall comply with AMS 2750F Class 2 requirements and are subject to Tinker Technical POC approval before shipment. ? Manufacturer shall perform Temperature Uniformity Survey (TUS) before shipment. TUS procedure and results shall comply with AMS 2750F Class 2 requirements and are subject to Tinker Technical POC approval before shipment. Installation/Training: ? Turn-key installation shall be provided ? Tinker AFB must be notified no less than one week prior to shipment for site prep ? Operational training, maintenance training, and programming training shall be provided to Tinker AFB shop, maintenance, and engineering personnel after installation. Miscellaneous ? 1 year warranty ? Manuals: 1 hardcopy, 1 digital Owner?s manual in English o Owner?s manual shall include operation instructions, maintenance instructions, and engineering drawings (heating elements, electrical wiring, mechanical design, etc.) with part numbers should replacement parts be needed. ? Spare parts for 3 months service ? Thermocouple calibration certificates for any and all thermocouples installed in the furnace, excluding extension wire.? Amendments: Amendment1 (May 3, 2022): The Government removed the Brand Name requirement from the Combined Synopsis Solicitation. Additionally, the Government amended the combined synopsis solicitation via amendment1 as attached.?

category_id: Equipment: Air Circulation, Boilers, Furnace, Refrigeration Bids
title: Total Small Business Set-Aside (FAR 19.5): Supply, Deliver, and Install Refrigeration Equipment
description: Description: This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in Subpart 12.6 of the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR), as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. ?This announcement constitutes the only solicitation. ?Quotations are being requested. The solicitation number is 1240BK22Q0053 and is issued as a Request for Quotation (RFQ), under the Simplified Acquisition Procedures (SAP), Part 13.5. The NAICS code is 333415. ?The small business size standard is 1250 employees. ?This acquisition is a Total Small business set-aside. ?This solicitation is for a firm fixed price contract. ?The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular FAC 2022-4. ? The following clauses and provisions apply to this acquisition: 52.212-1 Instructions to Offerors Commercial Items; 52.212-2 Evaluation Commercial Items; the evaluation criteria stated in paragraph (a) of this provision are as follows: (1) Technical Capability to meet requirements stated herein, and (2) Price. ?The contract award will be offered to the best value offer made to the Government, considering technical capability and price; 52.212-3 Offeror Representations and Certifications Commercial Items; 52.212-4 Contract Terms and Conditions Commercial Items and 52.212-5 Contract Terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes or Executive Orders- Commercial Items. In paragraph (B) of 52.212-5, the following apply: 52.219-27, 52.222-3, 52.222-20, 52.222-21, 52.222-26, 52.222-54, 52.225-1, and 52.232-33. All clauses and provisions referenced in this announcement may be accessed at the following website: ?http://www.arnet.gov/far . ? ?

title: NSN 4130-01-672-1930, Compressor Refrigeration Unit
description: Defense Logistics Agency Troop Support (DLA) is conducting market research on National Stock Number 4130-01-672-1930, Compressor Refrigeration Unit.? DLA is committed to enhancing warfighter support and determining what your industry will be capable of providing with respect to the required items.? For this reason, DLA Troop Support would appreciate your company sharing its expertise and insight into how this item can be most efficiently procured.? Please note that this inquiry should not be interpreted as a solicitation for offers.? No information provided in response to this inquiry will be considered binding between the vendor and the Government.? With these facts in mind, it is requested that you review the item and answer the questions on the attached pages.? The answers you provide will remain confidential.?
